notesStmt.note: Avraham ben Yosef: inscribed with his name in the colophon, folio 193v. A birth record of the son of Ibrahim ibn Yusuf, inscribed on folio 193v, with a date of Adar 1781 (1470). A purchase note in Judeo-Arabic, folio 194v.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Former Prophets, accentuated and punctuated, with Targum, masorah magna and parva.

collation.p: 20 quires of 10 leaves each, apart from the following: i8, xv9, xvii9, and xx8. The quires are signed with Hebrew letters on the first page and marked with catchwords on the last page.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Yemenite square script, punctuated. Benayah [ben Sa'adyah ben Zekharyah ben Margaz], for manuscripts of the same scribe see Or 2211, 2348, 2370, 2375.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), an antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Museum from him on 13 December 1879, inscribed [195v].
